name: inhumanly
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in an extremely cruel way: The inspector said that she had behaved inhumanly towards the children in her care. During the conflict, many civilians were treated inhumanly by the occupying forces.
in a way that is unusual or frightening because it is not like a normal human being: The figure came towards us with inhumanly large strides. Most of the prison guards acted in an inhumanly robotic fashion.
More examplesFewer examplesPeople were dragged from their homes, imprisoned, and inhumanly treated.She was able to write at an inhumanly fast speed.
